summary: The Wildfire Emergency Preparedness Act of 2025 aims to improve firefighter preparedness and coordination in response to wildfires and wildland-urban interface fires.  Key provisions include: a national training plan and grant program managed by the Forest Service; establishing an Under Secretary of Agriculture for Fire Coordination;  allowing Department of Defense firefighters to assist in fire operations; health and safety research focused on firefighters; mental health assistance for first responders; supplemental firefighter grant programs; and reports to Congress. The bill focuses on training, coordination, and resources to improve fire response capabilities.
